briefTitle: Vitamin D and Residual Beta-Cell Function in Type 1 Diabetes
officialTitle: Vitamin D and Residual Beta-Cell Function in Type 1 Diabetes
summary: This project is designed to study the role of vitamin D supplementation on the honeymoon phase of type 1 diabetes in children who are on standardized insulin treatment. The results could lead to significant changes in the approach to the early phase of type 1 diabetes with a strong emphasis on prolonging the honeymoon phase by using vitamin D and maintaining these patients on a standardized insulin regimen. The overall goal is to reduce the long-term complications of type 1 diabetes.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline to 12 months at 3 months interval
